# List of Symbols {#sec-listofsymbols}

## Lowercase Greek letters

| Letter  | Symbol  | Uses                                            |
|:--------|:--------|:------------------------------------------------|
|alpha    |$\alpha$ |A generic constant, or a significance threshold  |
|beta     |$\beta$  |An intercept, slope, or other model coefficient  |
|gamma    |$\gamma$ |A step size                                      |
|delta    |$\delta$ |A partial derivative, or a tiny amount           |
|epsilon  |$\varepsilon$|An error term, or a tolerance factor         |
|eta      |$\eta$   |The linear predictor for a GLM                   |
|theta    |$\theta$ |A generic parameter or set of parameters         |
|lambda   |$\beta$  |The rate of a Poisson or exponential distribution|
|mu       |$\mu$    |The mean of a random variable                    |
|pi       |$\pi$    |The constant 3.14159..., or a probability        |
|rho      |$\rho$   |Correlation                                      |
|sigma    |$\sigma$ |The standard deviation of a random variable      |
|        |$\sigma^2$|The variance of a random variable                |
|phi      |$\phi$   |Dispersion parameter for quasi-likelihood models |
|chi      |$\chi$   |Symbol used to name the chi-squared distribution |

## Uppercase Greek letters

| Letter  | Symbol  | Uses                                            |
|:--------|:--------|:------------------------------------------------|
|Delta    |$\Delta$ |Change                                           |
|Pi       |$\Pi$    |Product                                          |
|Sigma    |$\Sigma$ |Sum                                              |
|Phi      |$\Phi$   |CDF of the standard normal distribution          |
|Omega    |$\Omega$ |Universal set (all possible outcomes)            |

## Set theory

| Name    | Symbol  | Meaning                                         |
|:--------|:--------|:------------------------------------------------|
|         |$\in$    |Is an element of                                 |
|         |$\subseteq$|Is a subset of (and can be equal to)           |
|         |$\cup$   |Union ("or")                                     |
|         |$\cap$   |Intersection ("and")                             |
|         |$\mathcal{A}^c$|A-complement ("everything *but* A")        |
|null     |$\emptyset$|The empty set (or null set)                    |
|Omega    |$\Omega$ |Universal set (all possible outcomes)            |
|         |$\mathbb{R}$|The real numbers                              |
|         |$\mathbb{Z}$|The integers                                  |
|       |$\mathbb{Z}^+,\mathbb{Z}^-$|The positive or negative integers|
|         |$\mathbb{N}$|The natural numbers (0, 1, 2, ...)            |

## Other mathematical symbols

| Name    | Symbol  | Meaning                                         |
|:--------|:--------|:------------------------------------------------|
|nabla    |$\nabla$ |Gradient (vector of first derivatives)           |
|factorial|$!$|Factorial operator, e.g. 5! = 5 x 4 x 3 x 2 x 1 = 120  |
||$\lfloor\;\rfloor$|Floor operator, e.g. $\lfloor3.14159\rfloor=3$   |
|         |$\sim$   |Is distributed according to, or depends upon     |
|         |$\approx$|Is approximately equal to                        |
|         |$\ll,\gg$|Is much less than, is much greater than          |
|         |$\perp$  |Perpendicular or orthogonal to, independent of   |
|dot      |$\circ$  |Dot product (a vector operator)                  |
|         |$|x|$    |Absolute value of a scalar x                     |
|         |$||\boldsymbol{x}||$|Magnitude (length) of a vector x      |
||$F^{-1},\mathbf{A}^{-1}$|Inverse of a function F or matrix A        |
||$\boldsymbol{x}^T,\mathbf{A}^T$|Transpose of a vector x or matrix A |
|         |$1\!\!1$ |Indicator function, or a vector of ones          |
|         |$\mathcal{L}$|Likelihood                                   |
|         |$\mathcal{l}$|Log-likelihood                               |
